page.title: 05TOURISM in GLAMIS
page.content:
Tourism is an important factor in the local economy. The nearby Glamis Castle draws many visitors each summer and a few of these spend time in the local shops and in looking at the village of Glamis.
Others come to see the village for its own attractions - the old buildings in the main street, the folk museum, and the Kirk, dating from 1450 which has a Celtic standing stone dating from around 750 in the manse garden.
There is rather limited bed and breakfast accomodation in the area. The Strathmore Arms in Glamis has a well known dining room, but no bedrooms.
